During the period of his so-called ‘Personal Rule

known by his enemies as the ‘Eleven Year Tyranny’ because he had dissolved Parliament and ruled by decree, Charles had resorted to dubious fiscal expedients, most notably ‘ship money,’ an annual levy for the reform of the navy that in 1635 was extended from English ports to inland towns. This inclusion of inland towns was construed as a new tax without parliamentary authorization
